main_definition: To make something greater in quantity or degree, to become larger or more numerous.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To grow in amount or size
meanings_and_examples.example: The company plans to increase its workforce by 20% next year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To rise above a certain level or standard
meanings_and_examples.example: The student's grades increased after she started studying more regularly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To add more of something to an existing amount
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to increase the number of vegetables in her salad by adding extra carrots and cucumbers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To enhance or augment a particular aspect
meanings_and_examples.example: The coach wanted to increase the team's speed during training sessions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make something more intense or stronger
meanings_and_examples.example: He increased the volume of his music so he could hear it better while working out.
